title: Video stops buffering and then take more time to load another seconds.
content:
Firefox version: 102.0b7 OS: Win 11

While watching videos(movies/anime) video takes much time to buffer. If video is of 20 minutes then it loads first few minutes then after watch time reaches that buffered video then it takes more time buffer.

What I am looking is for, how can I force firefox to buffer full video at once or is there any way to increase buffer size.
creator: pv8172

title: open dwf using firefox browser
content: how I can open .dwf files using the Mozilla Firefox browser?
creator: abedalraouf

title: Home page won't open on boot
content:
After last or previous update, Firefox does not load home page. Get message with last tabs:

Sorry. We’re having trouble getting your pages back.

We are having trouble restoring your last browsing session. Select Restore Session to try again.

Still not able to restore your session? Sometimes a tab is causing the issue. View previous tabs, remove the checkmark from the tabs you don’t need to recover, and then restore.

Did all this it is still happening. Last time removing some file folder did not correct. Do not want it to restore last session!

What is causing this?

James
creator: JJEULER

title: emails
content: How do I send a lager file on email? When I try it comes up 'you are about to send a msg of size 46.3MB. The size of the msg exceeds the global size limit of the server exceeds databytes limit (#5.3.4) I have zipped it still comes up the same.
creator: jannali

title: Firefox isn't loading a web page correctly
content: Firefox is not letting me get into my Paypal Mastercard account. When I attempt to log in via paypal, the account page doesn't load. Instead I'm taken back to the log in page. I thought the problem was the security setting I was the security setting I was using (Privacy Badger and Ublock Origin.) but removing them did not fix the problem.
creator: rmmcgee2

title: Cannot post on Blogger because a RECAPTCHA error keeps happening - firefox security settings to blame
content:
Hi - I am finding that since whatever recent damn Firefox update now i cant post on a blogger (blogspot.com) page as everytime i try to i get the same message that

"Could not connect to the reCAPTCHA service. Please check your internet connection and reload "

i reload and same thing happens. I saw a solution online that i have to allow cross-site tracking for this to work, however Firefox you dont give me the option to simply switch that off for this particular site from what i can see

so how to do fix this - will you rectify this problem with your security settings?
creator: mitchellnolte
